byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and MICHAEL CORKERY

abstract: Debt collection companies like Encore Capital Group are suing consumers to collect alleged unpaid debt, often without consumer's knowledge, and leveraging arbitration clauses inserted in consumer contracts to prevent legal challenges to tactic; strategy allows collection agencies to unearth debts banks have given up on and transform them into profit; critics charge companies should not be allowed to capitalize on arbitration clauses inserted in original contracts unrelated to collection companies (Series: Beware the Fine Print).
lead_paragraph: Debt buyers are using the courts to sue consumers and collect debt, then preventing those same consumers from using the courts to mount a challenge.

headline.main: Sued Over Old Debt, and Blocked From Suing Back
headline.print_headline: Creditors Sue, Then Block Use of Courts to Fight Back
